translated: Abhidharma-mahÄvibhÄá¹£Ä-Å›Ästra, fascicle 90
one
composed by 500 great arhats and others
tripiá¹­aka master Xuanzang respectfully received
the cessation of the latent tendency of ignorance that is to be eliminated by cultivation
the consciousness that takes it as an object and the consciousness that takes it as an object of apprehension
among the ninety-eight latent afflictions
how many latent afflictions increase for each one?
Answer: The consciousness that takes the cessation of the eye faculty as an object
the two categories in the desire realm and form realm,
and the omnipresent latent afflictions increase.
The consciousness that takes it as an object of apprehension
in the desire realm and form realm, the conditioned objects,
the two categories in the formless realm,
and the omnipresent latent afflictions increase.
The consciousness that takes the cessation of the ear, nose, tongue, body, pleasure, and joy faculties as an object
and the consciousness that takes it as an object of apprehension are also like this.
The consciousness that takes the cessation of the female faculty as an object
the two categories in the desire realm,
and the omnipresent [latent afflictions],
the omnipresent [latent afflictions] in the form realm,
and the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation increase.
The consciousness that takes it as an object of apprehension
in the desire realm, the conditioned objects,
the three categories in the form realm,
The universal [contaminants] of the formless realm,
and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation increase.
The consciousness that takes the male faculty, the faculty of suffering, and the faculty of sorrow as objects of cessation,
and the consciousness that takes them as objects of condition as well, are also like this.
The consciousness that takes the faculty of life as an object of cessation,
the two categories of the three realms,
and the universal contaminants increase.
The consciousness that takes it as an object of condition,
the contaminants that take conditioned things of the three realms as objects increase.
The consciousness that takes the faculty of thought, the faculty of equanimity, and the five faculties such as faith as objects of cessation,
and the consciousness that takes them as objects of condition as well, are also like this.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
The path of eliminating the contaminants of the eye faculty up to the ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm,
the consciousness that takes it as an object and the consciousness that takes it as an object of condition,
how many contaminants increase for each?
Answer: The path of eliminating the eye faculty,
the consciousness that takes it as an object and the consciousness that takes it as an object of condition,
the contaminants of the four categories of the three realms increase.
The path of eliminating the ear, nose, tongue, body, faculty of life, faculty of thought, faculty of equanimity, and the five faculties such as faith,
the consciousness that takes it as an object and the consciousness that takes it as an object of condition are also like this.
The consciousness that takes the path of eliminating the female faculty as an object,
The four types in the desire realm.
The three types of latent afflictions in the form realm increase.
The sixth consciousness as object condition and the sixth consciousness as object-object condition in the desire and form realms are of four types.
In the formless realm, they are of two types.ğŸ”½And the universal latent afflictions increase.
The path of practice for severing the male faculty, the faculty of suffering, and the faculty of sorrow.
The sixth consciousness as object condition and the sixth consciousness as object-object condition are also like this.
The path of practice for severing the faculty of pleasure.
The sixth consciousness as object condition in the desire and form realms is of four types.
In the formless realm, it is of two types.
And the universal latent afflictions increase.
The sixth consciousness as object-object condition.
The latent afflictions of the three realms are of four types and increase. The path of practice for severing the faculty of joy.
The sixth consciousness as object condition and the sixth consciousness as object-object condition are also like this.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
The eye faculty up to the ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm.

The sixth consciousness as object condition and the sixth consciousness as object-object condition increase the latent afflictions.ğŸ”½How many are bound by the object but not by association?ğŸ”½How many are bound by association but not by the object?
How many are bound by the object and also by association?
How many are not bound by the object and also not bound by association?
Answer: The latent afflictions that increase the consciousness associated with the eye faculty
are bound by the conditioned object but not bound by association.
Namely, the non-pervasive afflictions abandoned by seeing suffering and origin in the desire and form realms,
the pervasive afflictions in the formless realm,
and the latent afflictions abandoned by cultivation.
There are those bound by the conditioned association but not bound by the object.
Namely, the pervasive latent afflictions that take the eye faculty as their object in the desire and form realms, and in other realms and stages.
There are those bound by the conditioned object and also bound by association.
Namely, the pervasive afflictions in the desire and form realms,
and the latent afflictions abandoned by cultivation.
The latent afflictions that increase the consciousness associated with the eye faculty
are neither bound by the object nor bound by association.
If the latent afflictions that do not increase this [consciousness]
are neither bound by the object nor bound by association with this [consciousness],
Namely, the two categories in the three realms,
and the non-pervasive latent afflictions abandoned by seeing suffering and origin in the formless realm.
The latent afflictions that increase the eye faculty's dominant condition and the consciousness that takes it as its object,
are bound by the object of conditioned [dharmas], but not bound by association.
This refers to the contaminated objects that are abandoned by seeing the truth of the path in the three realms,
and the non-pervasive latent afflictions abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and accumulation in the formless realm.
The conditioned [dharmas] are bound by association but not by the object.
This refers to the pure objects abandoned by seeing the truth of the path in the three realms,
and the pervasive latent afflictions with objects in other realms and stages in the desire and form realms.
The conditioned [dharmas] are bound by both the object and association.
This refers to the three categories in the desire and form realms,
the pervasive [afflictions] in the formless realm,
and the latent afflictions abandoned by cultivation.
The latent afflictions that increase the eye faculty's dominant condition and the consciousness that takes it as its object,
are neither bound by the object nor bound by association.
If the latent afflictions do not increase in this [faculty],
they are neither bound by the object of this [faculty],
nor bound by association.
This refers to all the latent afflictions abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation in the three realms, and the consciousness that takes the ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties as its objects.
The same applies to the latent afflictions that increase due to the cognizing consciousness that takes it as its object.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the cognizing consciousness that takes the female faculty as its object
are bound by the object of the conditioned, but not by association.
This refers to the non-pervasive afflictions eliminated by seeing suffering and its cause in the desire realm,
the pervasive afflictions in the form realm,
and the latent afflictions eliminated by cultivation.
There are none that are bound by association with the conditioned, but not by the object.
There are some that are bound by the object of the conditioned and also by association.
This refers to the pervasive afflictions in the desire realm,
and the latent afflictions eliminated by cultivation.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the cognizing consciousness that takes the female faculty as its objectğŸ”½are neither bound by the object nor by association.
There are none.
If the latent afflictions do not increase in this [cognizing consciousness],
they are neither bound by the object of this [cognizing consciousness]
nor by association.
This refers to the two categories in the desire and form realms,
the non-pervasive afflictions eliminated by seeing suffering and its cause in the form realm,
and all the latent afflictions in the formless realm.ğŸ”½The latent afflictions that increase due to the cognizing consciousness that takes the female faculty as its object and condition
The latent afflictions that increase the consciousness that takes the female faculty as its object and dominant condition.
The fetter of the object is not the fetter of association.
It refers to the contaminated objects to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm.
The non-pervasive factors to be eliminated by seeing the truths of suffering and origin in the form realm.
The pervasive factors in the formless realm.
And the proclivities to be eliminated by cultivation.
The fetter of association is not the fetter of the object.
It refers to the pure objects to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm.
And the pervasive proclivities with objects in other realms and stages in the desire and form realms.
The fetter of the object is also the fetter of association.
It refers to the three categories in the desire realm, the pervasive factors in the form realm,

and the proclivities to be eliminated by cultivation.ğŸ”½The proclivities that increase with the consciousness that has the female faculty as its object are not the fetter of the object nor the fetter of association.
There is none.
If the proclivities do not increase with this,
they are not the fetter of the object with regard to this,
and also not the fetter of association.
It refers to all that is to be eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm,
and the two categories in the form and formless realms.

and the contaminants to be eliminated by insight into suffering and into the origin in the formless realm that are not universal.ğŸ”½The associated and the objects of the associated consciousnesses of the male faculty and the faculty of pain
are also the same.
The contaminants that increase with the consciousness that has the life faculty as its object
are bound to the object of the conditioned, but not bound to association.
They are the contaminants to be eliminated by insight into suffering and into the origin in the three realms that are not universal.
The conditioned are bound to association, but not bound to the object.
They are the contaminants that have the life faculty as their object in the three realms, the contaminants of other realms and stages that are universal.
The conditioned are bound to the object and also bound to association.
They are the universal contaminants and those to be eliminated by cultivation in the three realms.
The contaminants that increase with the consciousness that has the life faculty as its object
are not bound to the object,ğŸ”½and also not bound to association.
There are none.
If the contaminants do not increase with this,
they are not bound to the object of this,
and also not bound to association.
They are the contaminants of the three categories in the three realms.
The contaminants that increase with the consciousness that has the life faculty as its object and condition
The conditioned are bound by the object but not by association.
This refers to the latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the truth of the path in the three realms and have contaminated objects.
The conditioned are bound by association but not by the object.
This refers to the latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the truth of the path in the three realms and have pure objects,
as well as the universal latent afflictions that take other realms and stages as their objects in the three realms.
The conditioned are bound by both the object and association.
This refers to the latent afflictions of the three categories in the three realms.
The latent afflictions that increase through the consciousness that takes the life faculty as its object and condition.
There are none that are not bound by the object and also not bound by association.
If the latent afflictions do not increase in this [consciousness],
then they are not bound by the object in this [consciousness],
and also not bound by association in this [consciousness].
This refers to all the latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the truth of cessation in the three realms.
The consciousness that takes the mind faculty as its object,
and the latent afflictions that increase through the consciousness that takes it as its object and condition.
There are none that are bound by the object but not by association in the conditioned [realm].
The conditioned are bound by association but not by the object.
This refers to the latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the truth of the path in the three realms and have pure objects.
And the universal contaminants of the three realms that take the mental faculty of other realms and stages as their objects.
The contaminants that increase with the conditioned objects as their objects are also the contaminants that increase with the associated objects.
That is, the contaminants of the three realms that take the contaminated as their objects.
The contaminants that increase with the consciousnesses that take the mental faculty as their objects.
There are none that are neither the contaminants that increase with the objects as their objects nor the contaminants that increase with the associated objects.
If the contaminants do not increase with this [mental faculty],
they are not the contaminants that increase with the objects as their objects.
They are also not the contaminants that increase with the associated objects.
That is, the contaminants of the three realms that take the unconditioned as their objects.
The contaminants that increase with the consciousnesses that take the faculty of equanimity as their objects and the consciousnesses that take them as their objects as a condition are also like this.
The contaminants that increase with the consciousnesses that take the faculty of pleasure as their objects.
The conditioned objects as their objects are the contaminants that increase with the associated objects.
They are not the contaminants that increase with the objects as their objects.
That is, the contaminants of the desire realm and the formless realm that are eliminated by the path of seeing and take the contaminated as their objects.
The non-pervasive contaminants of the desire realm that are eliminated by the paths of seeing suffering and seeing its origin.
The pervasive contaminants of the formless realm.
And the contaminants that are eliminated by cultivation.
The conditioned associated objects are the contaminants that increase with the associated objects, but not the contaminants that increase with the objects as their objects.
That is, the contaminants of the three realms that are eliminated by the path of seeing and take the uncontaminated as their objects.
And the pervasive latent afflictions of the desire and form realms that take the faculty of pleasure as their object.
The fetters of the conditioned objects and the fetters of association exist.
Namely, the pervasive and cultivated latent afflictions of the desire realm,
And the latent afflictions of the form realm that take the contaminated as their object.
The latent afflictions that increase with the faculty of pleasure,ğŸ”½Are not the fetters of the object,
Nor are they the fetters of association.
If the latent afflictions do not increase with this,
They are not the fetters of the object with regard to this,
Nor are they the fetters of association.
Namely, the desire and formless realms,ğŸ”½All the latent afflictions abandoned by seeing cessation in the form realm, and those that take the unconditioned as their object,
And the non-pervasive latent afflictions abandoned by seeing suffering and accumulation in the formless realm.
The latent afflictions that increase with the consciousness that takes the faculty of pleasure as its object,
The fetters of the conditioned objects exist, but not the fetters of association.
Namely, the non-pervasive latent afflictions abandoned by seeing suffering and accumulation in the formless realm.
The fetters of association exist, but not the fetters of the objects.
Namely, the pure objects abandoned by seeing the path in the three realms.
and the pervasive latent afflictions of the three realms and other realms and stages.
The fetters of the conditioned objects and the fetters of association exist.
Namely, the three categories of the desire realm and the impure objects abandoned by the path of seeing.
All the impure objects of the form realm.
The pervasive [afflictions] of the formless realm.
The impure objects abandoned by the path of cultivation and the path of seeing.
The latent afflictions of the impure objects.
The latent afflictions that increase with the consciousness that takes the faculty of pleasure as its object.
There are none that are neither the fetters of the objects nor the fetters of association.
If the latent afflictions do not increase with this,ğŸ”½and are neither the fetters of the objects nor the fetters of association with this,
then
all those abandoned by the path of seeing in the desire and formless realms, and the latent afflictions with the unconditioned objects abandoned by the path of seeing in the form realm.
The latent afflictions that increase with the consciousness that takes the faculty of joy as its object.
The fetters of the conditioned objects but not the fetters of association.
Namely, the pervasive [afflictions] of the formless realm.
Those abandoned by the path of cultivation and the path of seeing.
The latent afflictions of the impure objects.
There are those that are bound by association with conditioned [dharmas] but not bound by objects.

Namely, the impure dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the path in the three realms, and the universal defilements that take joy as their object in the desire and form realms, and the defilements of other realms and stages.
There are those that are bound by objects of conditioned [dharmas]
and also bound by association.
Namely, the latent afflictions that take all impure dharmas in the desire and form realms as their objects.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousnesses that take joy as their object.ğŸ”½There are those that are neither bound by objects
nor bound by association.
If the latent afflictions do not increase in a certain [dharma],
then they are neither bound by objects
nor bound by association in that [dharma].
Namely, the latent afflictions that take the unconditioned dharmas to be eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire and form realms as their objects,
all the latent afflictions to be eliminated by seeing cessation in the formless realm, and the non-universal ones to be eliminated by seeing suffering and aggregation in the formless realm.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousnesses that take joy as their object and that take other dharmas as their objects.
There are those that are bound by objects of conditioned [dharmas] but not bound by association.
Namely, the non-universal latent afflictions to be eliminated by seeing suffering and aggregation in the formless realm.
There are those that are bound by association with conditioned [dharmas] but not bound by objects.
Namely, the impure objects of the three realms that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing.
And the universal contaminants of the three realms that take other realms and stages as objects.
There are those that are bound by objects and also bound by association with conditioned [dharmas].
Namely, all the impure objects of the realms of desire and form.
The universal [contaminants] of the formless realm.
The contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation and by the path of seeing that take impure objects as objects.
The contaminants that increase through the recognition that takes the faculty of joy as its object.ğŸ”½There are none that are not bound by objects.
Nor are there any that are not bound by association.
If there are contaminants that do not increase through this [faculty of joy],
then with regard to this [faculty of joy], they are not bound by objects.
Nor are they bound by association.
Namely, the objects of cessation of the realms of desire and form that take the unconditioned as objects.
And all the contaminants of the formless realm that are to be eliminated by the path of cessation.
The contaminants that increase through the recognition that takes the faculty of sorrow as its object.
There are those that are bound by objects of conditioned [dharmas] but not bound by association.
Namely, the universal [contaminants] of the realm of form.
And the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.
There is none that is bound by association with the conditioned but not bound by the object.
There are those that are bound by the object and also bound by association with the conditioned.
Namely, all the latent afflictions that take the contaminated factors of the desire realm as their object.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes the faculty of sorrow as its object.
There is none that is not bound by the object and also not bound by association.
If the latent afflictions do not increase in this [faculty of sorrow],
then they are not bound by the object in this [faculty of sorrow].
They are also not bound by association in this [faculty of sorrow].
Namely, all the latent afflictions that take the uncontaminated factors of the desire realm as their object.
The two types of latent afflictions in the form realm,
and those that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and origination but are not pervasive.
And all the latent afflictions in the formless realm.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes the faculty of sorrow as its object and also takes it as its object.
There are those that are bound by the object of the conditioned but not bound by association.
Namely, those that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and origination in the form realm but are not pervasive.
Those that are pervasive in the formless realm,
and those that are eliminated by cultivation.
There are those that are bound by association with the conditioned but not bound by the object.
Namely, those that take the uncontaminated factors as their object and are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of the path in the desire realm.
The pervasive latent afflictions of other realms and stages in the desire and form realms.
The fetters of the conditioned objects and the fetters of association exist.
Namely, all contaminated objects in the desire realm.
The pervasive [afflictions] of the form realm.
And the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the object-condition of the faculty of sorrow.
Are not fetters of the object.
Nor are they fetters of association.
If the latent afflictions that do not increase this [faculty of sorrow],ğŸ”½Are not fetters of the object with regard to this [faculty of sorrow],
And are also not fetters of association with regard to this [faculty of sorrow],
Namely, the latent afflictions with unconditioned objects to be eliminated by the path of cultivation in the desire realm.
The two categories in the form and formless realms.
And the non-pervasive latent afflictions to be eliminated by seeing the truth of suffering and origination in the formless realm.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the object-condition of the five faculties such as faith, etc.
The fetters of the conditioned objects exist, but not the fetters of association.
Namely, the non-pervasive [afflictions] to be eliminated by seeing the truths of suffering and origination in the three realms.
And the contaminated objects to be eliminated by seeing the truth of the path.
The fetters of association exist, but not the fetters of the object.
Namely, the uncontaminated [dharmas] that are objects of the path of seeing to be eliminated in the three realms.
Namely, the pure dharmas that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing in the three realms, and those that take the five roots such as faith as their objects.
The universal contaminants that take other realms and stages as their objects in the three realms.
The fetters of conditioned objects and the fetters of association.
Namely, the universal contaminants in the three realms,
and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.
The contaminants that increase through taking the consciousness that takes the five roots such as faith as its object as their objects.ğŸ”½They are not the fetters of the objects,
and they are also not the fetters of association.
If they do not increase the contaminants,ğŸ”½they are not the fetters of the objects with regard to them,
and they are also not the fetters of association with regard to them.
Namely, all the contaminants to be eliminated by the path of seeing in the three realms.
The contaminants that increase through taking the consciousness that takes the five roots such as faith as its object as their objects.
There are none that are the fetters of conditioned objects and not the fetters of association. There are conditioned fetters of association but not fetters of objects.
Namely, the pure dharmas that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing in the three realms,
and the universal contaminants that take other realms and stages as their objects.
The fetters of conditioned objects and the fetters of association.
Namely, the three divisions of the three realms.
And the proclivities that are to be eliminated by the path of insight and have contaminated objects.
The proclivities that increase through the object condition of the consciousness that has the five roots such as faith as its object.
There are none that are neither bound by the object nor bound by association.
If the proclivities do not increase through this,
they are not bound by the object.
They are also not bound by association.
Namely, all the proclivities to be eliminated by insight in the three realms.
The proclivities that increase through the consciousness that has the three pure roots as its object.
They are bound by the object of the conditioned.
They are not bound by association.
Namely, the universal proclivities and those to be eliminated by cultivation in the three realms,
and the proclivities that are to be eliminated by the path of insight and have contaminated objects in the three realms.
They are bound by association of the conditioned, but not bound by the object.
Namely, the proclivities that are to be eliminated by the path of insight in the three realms and have the pure objects as their object.
There are none that are bound by the object of the conditioned and also bound by association.
The proclivities that increase through the consciousness that has the three pure roots as its object.ğŸ”½They are not bound by the object.
They are also not bound by association. There are none.
If it is not the proclivity that increases in this [object],
it is not the object-bondage in this [object],
and it is also not the association-bondage.
This refers to all [proclivities] that are eliminated by seeing cessation in the three realms,
and the proclivities that are eliminated by seeing suffering and seeing origination, which are not universal.
The proclivities that increase in the dependent consciousness of the three pure faculties
are object-bondage in conditioned [dharmas], but not association-bondage.
This refers to the proclivities that are eliminated by seeing suffering and seeing origination in the three realms, which are not universal.
There is association-bondage in conditioned [dharmas], but not object-bondage.
This refers to the proclivities that are eliminated by seeing the path in the three realms, which have pure objects,
and the universal proclivities that have other realms and stages as objects.
There is both object-bondage and association-bondage in conditioned [dharmas].
This refers to the universal proclivities in the three realms, those that are eliminated by cultivation,
and the proclivities that are eliminated by seeing the path, which have contaminated objects.
The proclivities that increase in the dependent consciousness of the three pure facultiesğŸ”½are neither object-bondage nor association-bondage.
There is none [that is neither].
If it is not the proclivity that increases in this [object],
But it is not bound to the non-object.
But in this case, it is neither an object-bond nor an associated-bond.
This refers to all the latent afflictions to be eliminated by seeing the truth of cessation in the three realms.

The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this. The cessation of the eye faculty up to the cessation of ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm,
the latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes them as objects and the consciousness that takes their objects as objects,
how many are object-bonds but not associated-bonds,
how many are associated-bonds but not object-bonds,
how many are both object-bonds and associated-bonds,
and how many are neither object-bonds nor associated-bonds?
The answer is: The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes the cessation of the eye faculty as an object
are object-bonds but not associated-bonds.
This refers to the universal [afflictions] of the desire realm and form realm,
and the latent afflictions with conditioned objects to be eliminated by cultivation and the latent afflictions to be eliminated by seeing the truth of cessation.
They are associated-bonds but not object-bonds.
This refers to the latent afflictions with unconditioned objects to be eliminated by seeing the truth of cessation in the desire realm and form realm.
There is none that is both bound by the object and bound by association.
The eye root ceases, and the associated latent afflictions increase in the consciousness that is the condition.
There is none that is neither bound by the object nor bound by association.
If the latent afflictions do not increase in this [consciousness], they are neither bound by the object nor bound by association.
Namely, all [latent afflictions] eliminated during the path of seeing in the desire and form realms,
and the non-pervasive [latent afflictions] eliminated during the [first] two truths of suffering and accumulation in the [formless] realm of formlessness.
The latent afflictions that increase in the consciousness that is the condition
are bound by the object but not bound by association.
Namely, the [latent afflictions] eliminated during the path of seeing in the three realms that take contaminated [dharmas] as their objects,
and the non-pervasive [latent afflictions] eliminated during the [first] two truths of suffering and accumulation in the desire and form realms,
as well as the pervasive [latent afflictions] in the formless realm.
The latent afflictions eliminated during [the path of] cultivation.
Are bound by association but not bound by the object.
Namely, the [latent afflictions] eliminated during the path of seeing in the three realms that take the uncontaminated [dharmas] as their objects,
as well as the pervasive [latent afflictions] in the desire and form realms that take other realms and stages as their objects.
Those that are both bound by the object and bound by association are:
The universal [contaminants] of the desire and form realms,
and the contaminants that are abandoned by seeing cessation, and have conditioned things as their objects.
The contaminants that increase through the cognition of the cessation of the eye faculty,
are neither bound by the object nor bound by association.
If the contaminants do not increase through this [cognition],ğŸ”½and are neither bound by the object nor bound by association with this [cognition],
then
The contaminants that have unconditioned things as their objects and are abandoned by seeing cessation in the desire and form realms,
all those abandoned by seeing cessation in the formless realm,
and the contaminants that are abandoned by seeing suffering and origination, but are not universal.
The contaminants that increase through the cognition of the cessation of the ear, nose, tongue, body, pleasure, and joy faculties,
and through the cognition of the cessation of their objects, are also like this.
The contaminants that increase through the cognition of the cessation of the female faculty,
are bound by the object of conditioned things, but not bound by association.
They are the universal [contaminants] of the desire and form realms,
and the contaminants that are abandoned by seeing cessation in the desire realm, and have conditioned things as their objects.
There are those that are bound by association but not by object.
Namely, the latent tendencies of the unconditioned that are to be eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm are not bound by either the conditioned object or by association.
The latent tendencies that increase due to the consciousness that takes the cessation of the female faculty as its object.
There are none that are not bound by object or by association.
If they do not increase the latent tendencies,
then they are not bound by object with regard to this.
They are also not bound by association.
Namely, all those to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm,
those to be eliminated by seeing suffering and origination that are not pervasive,
those in the two categories to be eliminated by seeing suffering and origination in the form realm that are not pervasive,
and all the latent tendencies in the formless realm.
The latent tendencies that increase due to the consciousness that takes them as objects.
They are bound by the conditioned object but not by association.
Namely, those to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm that have contaminated objects,
those to be eliminated by seeing suffering and origination in the desire and form realms that are not pervasive,
and the pervasive and those to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm.
There are those that are bound by association with conditioned [dharmas] but not bound by objects.
Namely, the pure [dharmas] to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm,
and the universal contaminants with objects in other realms and stages in the desire and form realms.
There are those that are bound by objects and also bound by association with conditioned [dharmas].
Namely, the universal contaminants and those to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire and form realms, and the conditioned contaminants to be eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm.

The contaminants that increase with the consciousness that has the cessation of the female faculty as its object and the consciousness that has the cessation of the female faculty as its object and condition are
not bound by objects and also not bound by association.

The consciousness that takes them as objects and the consciousness that takes their corresponding objects as objects.
Who possesses which, and who does not possess which?
The cessation of the eye faculty as an object of consciousness is in the desire realm and form realm.
Noble ones born in the formless realm possess it, while ordinary beings born in the formless realm do not possess it.
The consciousness that takes their corresponding objects as objects is possessed by all sentient beings.
The cessation of the ear, nose, tongue, body, pleasure, and joy faculties.
The consciousness that takes them as objects and the consciousness that takes their corresponding objects as objects are also like this.
The cessation of the female faculty as an object of consciousness is in the desire realm and form realm, and noble ones born in the formless realm possess it.
Ordinary beings born in the formless realm do not possess it.
The consciousness that takes their corresponding objects as objects is in the sphere of infinite space and below.
Noble ones born above possess it.
Ordinary beings born above do not possess it.

The cessation of the male faculty and the faculty of suffering and sorrow are also like this in terms of the consciousness that takes them as objects and the consciousness that takes them as objects and conditions.
The cessation of the faculty of life is also like this in terms of the consciousness that takes it as an object and the consciousness that takes it as an object and conditions.
All sentient beings are endowed with it.

The cessation of the mental faculty, the faculty of equanimity, and the five faculties such as faith are also like this in terms of the consciousness that takes them as objects and the consciousness that takes them as objects and conditions.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
The eye faculty up to the formless realm.
The cessation of the ignorance that is eliminated by cultivation.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes it as an object and the consciousness that takes it as an object and conditions.
Who is endowed with what, and who is not endowed with what?
The answer: The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes the cessation of the eye faculty as an object.
Those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the form realm are endowed with it.
Those who have already eliminated the defilements of the form realm are not endowed with it.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes it as an object and conditions.
Those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the formless realm are endowed with it.
Those who have already eliminated the defilements of the formless realm are not endowed with it.

The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes the cessation of the ear, nose, tongue, body, pleasure, and joy faculties as objects and the consciousness that takes them as objects and conditions are also like this.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the consciousness that takes the cessation of the female faculty as an object.
Those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the form realm possess it.
Those who have already eliminated the defilements of the form realm do not possess it.
The latent afflictions that increase the perceiving consciousness and the perceived object consciousness.
Those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the sphere of infinite space possess it.

Those who have already eliminated the defilements of the sphere of infinite space do not possess it.ğŸ”½The same applies to the perceiving consciousness and the perceived object consciousness that increase the latent afflictions of the male faculty, the faculties of pain and grief.
The same applies to the perceiving consciousness and the perceived object consciousness that increase the latent afflictions of the life faculty.
Those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the formless realm possess it.
Those who have already eliminated the defilements of the formless realm do not possess it.

The same applies to the perceiving consciousness and the perceived object consciousness that increase the latent afflictions of the mental faculty, the faculty of equanimity, and the five faculties such as faith.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
